p:
Interestingly, influenza vaccination in humans enhanced levels of the anti-inflammatory cytokine interleukin 10 (IL-10)
136 , while prophylactic treatment with oseltamivir (Tamiflu) decreased disease severity of influenza in both human and mouse models, and did not appear to interfere with appropriate T cell responses to new influenza infection
137 . It may be that vaccination is protective for nervous system inflammatory responses even from viruses that do not infect neurons and astrocytes.
